intro: Pseudocentema angolense, commonly known as the Angola false centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, small flowers. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slight pubescence, while its flowers are usually white or pale yellow. Pseudocentema angolense is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
